info.title: IBM Aspera Faspex API
info.description:
Use the Faspex API to:
  * send, view, and download packages
  * manage and work with shared inboxes and shared folders
  * manage users and workgroups
  * configure your Faspex server

tags.name: Application Events
tags.description: An application event reflects user actions or system events that have been recorded.

tags.name: Distribution lists
tags.description: A distribution list is a list of contacts that you can send packages to.

tags.name: Email notifications
tags.description: Configure email notifications sent for different Faspex events.

tags.name: Global user properties
tags.description: A user property is a custom field that stores additional metadata about a user. If required, an admin or self-registering user must provide a value for the field to create the user or register an account.

tags.name: My account
tags.description: Get your account details, reset your password, and Update your account preferences and notification settings.

tags.name: Nodes
tags.description: A node is a server running an IBM Aspera transfer product configured for use with Faspex. Faspex primarily uses nodes as storage for user-uploaded files and folders. Nodes can also be configured for use by permitted senders as a content source when sending a package. Faspex communicates to a node through the Node API. See the transfer product documentation for more information on how to configure a node for Faspex.

tags.name: OAuth 2 clients
tags.description:
Faspex supports OAuth 2 for a variety of flows. Use the:
* WebOauthClient schema if your application is a web application
* JwtOauthClient schema if your application does not use authenticated endpoints
* PkceOauthClient schema if your application is a mobile application

tags.name: Packages
tags.description: A package is a collection of files and folders with metadata. Users upload content to Faspex and Faspex makes it available as a package for recipients to download.

tags.name: Rate limits
tags.description: Configure API server rate limits (enforced per IP address).

tags.name: Registrations
tags.description: Moderate self-registration requests

tags.name: Relays
tags.description: Relays transfer copies of uploaded files to specified destinations.

tags.name: Remote transfers
tags.description: Send a package to a specified shared folder.

tags.name: Reset passwords
tags.description: Administrators can reset passwords for all users or for a subset of users. Users with reset passwords need to create a new account password before logging in. You cannot reset the passwords of SAML, directory service, and external users.

tags.name: SAML
tags.description: Faspex supports Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) 2.0, an XML-based standard that allows secure web domains to exchange user authentication and authorization data. With the SAML model, you can configure Faspex as a SAML online service provider (SP) that contacts a separate online identity provider (IdP) to authenticate users.

tags.name: SAML authorization
tags.description: Add a SAML configuration to Faspex to allow users to log in using SAML.

tags.name: SAML groups
tags.description: A Faspex group that corresponds to a group in a SAML IdP.

tags.name: SAML user properties
tags.description: Faspex can import SAML fields in your SAML identity provider (IdP) as user properties.

tags.name: Shared folders
tags.description: Shared folders are also known as storage locations. Shared folders are directories on a node. You can use files and folders in shared folders as the source of content for a package.

tags.name: Shared inboxes
tags.description: A shared inbox provides a file submission system for users to share packages.

tags.name: Shared inbox memberships
tags.description: Shared inbox members include Faspex users, SAML groups, and directory service groups.

tags.name: Shared inbox packages
tags.description: Packages sent to a shared inbox are available to all members of the shared inbox.

tags.name: SMTP
tags.description: Connect Faspex to an SMTP server for Faspex to use to send emails.

tags.name: Transfers
tags.description: Get information on active and inactive transfers.

tags.name: Transfer specification
tags.description: Transfers require transfer specifications to determine transfer settings.

tags.name: Workgroups
tags.description: Workgroups define a group of users that can be sent packages as a collective whole. A Faspex administrator determines who has permissions to send packages to a workgroup and where those packages are stored. The administrator also determines whether members can see and send packages to other workgroup members.

tags.name: Workgroup memberships
tags.description: Workgroup members include Faspex users, SAML groups, and directory service groups.

tags.name: Workgroup packages
tags.description: Packages sent to a workgroup are available to all members of the workgroup.

get.description: Returns a hash of the Faspex server advanced configuration.

put.description: Returns a hash of the Faspex server advanced configuration.

get.summary: Authorize to a registered OAuth client
get.description: When you call this endpoint, you are redirected to the Faspex login page to log in as a user. By logging in, you are implicitly authorizing the client to act as that user. Once authenticated, you are redirected to the given `redirect_uri`. Implement a GET endpoint that matches the `redirect_uri` on your application that can recieve and handle the URL-encoded authorization code.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: OAuth client ID.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URL to redirect users to after successful authentication. Must use the HTTPS protocol.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The authorization response format.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A unique string to verify the identity of the auth server. It is used to prevent CSRF attacks.

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: The code challenge is a Base64-encoded SHA256 hash of the code verifier. The code challenge is used for PKCE requests.

parameters.name: code_challenge_method
parameters.description: The code challenge method used to generate code challenge. The code challenge is used for PKCE requests.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: Specifies whether to redirect user to the Faspex login screen. Use this param to bypass automatic redirection to a SAML Identity Provider.

schema.description: The URL the auth server redirects the user to. Syntax: redirect_uri?code=value&&state=value

message.description: Invalid parameters

request_id.description: A unique request ID that can be used to trace a request from end-to-end.

post.description: Returns authorization code for a registered OAuth client, authenticated using HTTP basic auth.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: OAuth client ID.

code.description: The authorization code to be used in POST /auth/token API.

parameters.name: created_time
parameters.description: Filter by created_time that matches the given criteria. Prefix Right-Hand-Side colon operator to a datetime value (ISO formatted) to denote the comparison. Supported operators are: "gte:" for greater than or equal (e.g. "created_time=gte:2021-08-21T17:03:48"),         "lte:" for less than or equal (e.g. "created_time=lte:2021-09-21T17:03:48"). To provide a date range, use comma-separated list of values as shown by example

To provide a date range, use comma-separated list of values as shown by example

OAuth2.description:
This API uses OAuth 2 with the authorization code flow. The authorization flow can be generalized to these steps:
1. Authorize to a registered OAuth 2 client (configured based on the authorization method) using the /authorize endpoint.
2. You are redirected to the Faspex UI login page.
3. Submit your credentials to retrieve an `authorization_code` on the submitted `redirect_uri`.
4. Exchange the `authorization_code` for a JWT bearer token.
5. Use the bearer token to authenticate your API requests by including it in your requests as a header with format: `Authorization: Bearer <bearer_token>`

scopes.user: Grant permissions to send and receive packages (sending permissions defined by admins).
scopes.manager: Grant permissions to manage users, in addition to user permissions.
scopes.admin: Grant permissions to adjust server configurations, manage managers and users, and access to all APIs, in addition to manager permissions.
scopes.workgroup_admin: Grant permissions to manage workgroups assigned by an admin or workgroup admin.
scopes.shared_inbox_admin: Grant permissions to manage shared inboxes assigned by an admin or shared inbox admin.
scopes.client_only: Grant permissions to a restricted list of endpoints.

PasscodeAuth.description: Include the API Key in your requests as a header with format: `Passcode: <passcode>`. Based on passcode value, passcode authentication will have restricted permissions.
PasscodeAuth.name: Passcode

BasicAuth.description: This API uses HTTP basic auth to authenticate the API request for OAuth clients that allows HTTP basic authentication.
BasicAuth.name: Basic

user_fields_in_tags.description: The user_fields_in_tags determines what fields Faspex includes in sender and recipients fields in Faspex-generated tags for the ascp command. When the keys of user profile fields provided here, they are then added to the package metadata along with sender/recipient specific keys and values. For ex: If sender/recipient has 10 user profile fields, only those keys out of 10 fields will be then passed to the metadata.

disable_edit_email_html.description: When set to true, disables HTML editor option in email notifications. Administrators must use the form editor instead.

max_tags_length.description: The max_tags_length field limits the total length (after base64 encoding) of Faspex-generated tags for the ascp command. The value cannot exceed 4096 chars (bytes) due to a limitation in ascp. Note: If you set a value higher than 4096, Faspex sets the value to 1500.

enforce_self_registered_user_email_uniqu.description: Prevent someone from self-registering an account with an email address used by a Faspex user (not including emails associated with an external user).

hide_sender_username_to_external_recipie.description: When external users download a package, the Connect logs and Connect manifests do not show the sender username.

exclude_metadata_from_cookie.description: This setting excludes metadata from Faspex cookies. It also relaxes the length requirements on metadata from 2,000 characters per profile to 30,000 characters.

saml_user_lookup_attribute.description: During SAML user login, this attribute value from SAML response is used to lookup the user.

user_fields_in_tags.description: The user_fields_in_tags determines what fields Faspex includes in sender and recipients fields in Faspex-generated tags for the ascp command. offset.description: The index of the first resource in the results.If only one page, this will be 0. If paged result, this will be the index of the first resource.

limit.description: The maximum number of resources to return.

id.description: Unique identifier for the application event.

created_at.description: Reflects the time for the event

event_location.description: Field name or location associated with the event.

event_value.description: New field value if the event involves a value change.

event_value_old.description: Old field value being replaced if the event involves a value change.

file_id.description: File ID related to the event if applicable.

file_name.description: File name related to the event if applicable.

package_name.description: Package name related to the event if applicable.

package_id.description: Package ID related to the event if applicable.

event_type.description: Reflects the type of event taking place

application.description: Represents the application where the event was originated from.

message.description: Generic column with additional information related to the application event.

last_login_time.description: User last successful login date time.

status.description: Specifies the status of the user.

first_name.description: User first name. Not required and not editable for the "saml_user" type.

last_name.description: User last name. Not required and not editable for the "saml_user" type.

email.description: Email ID of the user. Multiple users may have the same email.

account_activated.description: Specifies whether the account is operational.

can_send_normal_packages.description: Specifies whether the user can send normal packages.

role.description: User role. Users cannot change their own role.

required.description: Specifies whether the user property is required.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user property is enabled.

saml_field_name.description: The SAML field name when the user property belongs to a SAML configuration.

saml_config_id.description: The SAML configuration ID when the user property belongs to a SAML configuration.

value.description: The user property value. You cannot update the value if the user property is configured by SAML. The value is populated by a SAML IDP.

GetConfiguration.description: Faspex server configuration options for any logged in user.

normal_pkg_mdata_profile_id.description: The metadata profile ID for a default package.

enable_alternate_address.description: Specifies whether the alternate address should be utilized for transfers (not configurable in 5.0).

server_address.description: The server address for this Faspex instance.

allow_send_to_email.description: Specifies whether packages can be sent to emails.

allow_send_to_email_default.description: Specifies whether users can send to external users by default.

package_link_expires.description: Specifies whether package submission links expire.

package_link_valid_days.description: The number of days until the package submission links expire.

package_link_expires_after_full_download.description: Specifies whether package submission links expire after a recipient downloads a sent package.

days_before_deleting_package_records.description: The number of days before deleting package records.

days_until_packages_expire.description: The number of days until a package expires.

use_strong_password.description: Specifies whether to enforce strong password requirements.

user_deactivation_login_interval_minutes.description: The number of minutes where the **user_deactivation_login_count** applies.

user_deactivation_login_count.description: The number of time a user can login within the **user_deactivation_login_interval_minutes** before being deactivated.

session_timeout_minutes.description: The number of minutes until current user sessions time out.

prevent_concurrent_login.description: Specifies whether to allow concurrent logins of the same user.

announcement.description: The announcement displayed on front page of Faspex instance.

home_page_message.description: The announcement displayed on home page of packages app.

delete_packages_after_download.description: Specifies whether to delete a package after a user downloads it.

delete_packages_after_download_condition.description: The after-download expiration behavior for a package.

require_encryption_at_rest.description: Specifies whether password protection is required when sending a package.

shared_inbox_can_override_ear.description: Specifies whether shared inboxes can override the global password protection policies.

package_instructions.description: The instructions to show on the send package page.

self_registration_type_external.description: The external user self-registration policy type.

registration_approval_ccs.description: The emails to notify when a someone registers for an account.

registration_approval_ccs_external.description: The emails to notify when an external user registers for an account.

login_terms_of_service.description: The terms of service a user must accept to register an account.

self_registered_users_can_send_to_each_o.description: Specifies whether self-registered users can send packages to each other.

invitations_allowed_by_default.description: Specifies whether invitations are allowed by default.

private_user_dir.description: Specifies whether user directories are kept private. When user directories are kept private, users can only send to their contact list, workgroups and sahred inboxes they are a member or, and distribution lists they have access to. This applies even if the user is allowed to send to all Faspex users.

save_metadata_to_file.description: Specifies whether the metadata of a package is saved as a file in the package root directory.

shared_inbox_can_override_public_url.description: Specifies whether shared inboxes can override the global public submission link setting.

deactivate_inactive_users.description: Specifies whether users are deactivated for inactivity.

user_deactivation_inactive_days.description: The number of days until a user is deactivated for inactivity.

remove_inactive_users.description: Specifies whether users are removed for inactivity.

user_removal_inactive_days.description: The number of days until a user is removed for inactivity.

force_password_reset_for_new_users.description: Specifies whether new users are forced to reset their passwords.

allow_self_unlock.description: Specifies whether locked users can unlock their accounts.

can_see_global_distribution_lists_defaul.description: Specifies whether users can see global distribution lists by default.

ignore_invalid_recipients.description: Specifies whether to allow users to send packages to invalid recipients are ignored. When sending to a distribution list, Faspex sends the package to all valid recipients and ignores the invalid recipients instead of failing the package.

account_display_name_format.description: The format for displaying account names.

require_external_users_registration.description: Specifies whether external users are required to register and log in before downloading a package.

global_default_password_expires.description: Specifies whether passwords expire for all users by default.

global_default_password_expiration_inter.description: The number of days until a password expires.

registration_external_use_default.description: Specifies whether the self-registration policy for external users follows the base self-registration policy for non-external users.

external_login_terms_of_service.description: The terms of service an external user must accept to register an account.

global_default_enforce_password_history.description: Specifies whether to prevent a user from reusing a number of old passwords by default.

global_default_password_history_limit.description: The default number of old passwords a user cannot reuse.

send_welcome_email_to_all_new_users.description: Specifies whether a welcome email is sent to new users.

login_label.description: The title on the login page.

login_instructions.description: Login instructions shown on the login page.
login_instructions.default: Use this option to log in with your Faspex account

registration_instructions.description: Instructions shown when someone registers an account.

users_can_send_to_all_faspex_users.description: Specifies whether users can send to any Faspex user.

allow_user_specified_delete_after_downlo.description: Specifies whether to allow users to set delete-after-download policies.

users_can_send_normal_packages.description: Specifies whether users can send normal packages.

package_terms_of_service.description: The terms of service a user must agree to on the send package form.

allow_external_send_to_faspex_user.description: Specifies whether external users can send to Faspex users.

invitation_link_expires.description: Specifies whether to enforce a time-based policy for invitation links.

invitation_link_expiration_policy.description: Specifies whether to enforce an expiration policy for invitation links.

invitation_link_days_valid.description: The number of hours until an invitation link expires. Enforced when invitation_link_expiration_policy is true.

invitation_link_expires_after_upload.description: Specifies whether an invitation link expires after being used for an upload. Enforced when invitation_link_expiration_policy is true.

allow_users_to_set_custom_link_expiratio.description: Specifies whether users can edit the expiration of an invitation link.

remove_inactive_saml_users.description: Specifies whether SAML users are removed for inactivity.

saml_user_removal_inactive_days.description: The number of days until a SAML user is removed for inactivity.

registration_blocklist.description: Users are not allowed to register accounts with emails from these domain names.

max_title_length_in_storage_paths.description: The maximum length of title in storage paths when creating directories on the HSTS node.

sender_quota_duration_hours.description: The number of hours in which a sender's quota is measured.

sender_quota_limit_mb.description: The maximum amount of data (in MB) a sender can transfer in the quota duration.

quota_recipient_allowlist.description: Package recipients with emails in these domains do not count toward a sender's quota.

quota_sender_allowlist.description: Package senders with emails in these domains are not limited by the sender quota.

can_override_ear_per_personal_invite.description: Specifies whether users can set password protection per invitation.

enforce_maximum_invitation_duration.description: Specifies whether the maximum invitation duration is enforced.

require_obfuscation.description: Specifies whether to enforce file masking on packages.

file_processing_enabled.description: Specifies whether file processing is enabled. If enabled, an external third-party application must process files in a package and update the package status before the package is made available. Cannot be enabled when downloads_during_transfers_enabled is true.

file_processing_timeout_minutes.description: Specify how long faspex should wait for a response from the external processor before a specific file times out (in minutes).

pkg_processing_timeout_minutes.description: Specify how long faspex should wait for a response for file updates before the entire package times out (in minutes).

initial_target_upload_rate_kbps.description: The default initial target upload rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

initial_target_download_rate_kbps.description: The default initial target download rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

max_target_upload_rate_kbps.description: The default max target upload rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

max_target_download_rate_kbps.description: The default max target download rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

http_fallback_enabled.description: Specifies whether HTTP fallback is enabled for transfers.

lock_minrate_policy.description: Specifies whether the minrate policy is locked for FASP transfers.

min_connect_version.description: The minimum release version for Connect.

encrypt_transfers.description: Specifies whether transfers should be encrypted.

lock_connect_sdk_version.description: Specifies whether the Connect SDK version is locked.

downloads_during_transfers_enabled.description: Specifies whether users can perform partial downloads of packages during transfers. Cannot be enabled when file_processing_enabled is true.

prefer_http_connect.description: Specifies whether to prefer Connect over HTTP transfers.

encryption_type.description: The encryption cipher used for transfers.

public_url_allowed.description: Specifies whether public submissions links are enabled.

public_url_allowed_default.description: Specifies whether public submissions links are enabled by default.

connect_install_prompt.description: Specifies which users group is prompted to install Connect if connect is not installed.

connect_url.description: The URL hosting the Connect SDK to allow your users to download Connect from a server of your choice. This URL must be accessible to Faspex and to your users.

strong_password_regex.description: A regular expression that can be used to customize strong password requirements. Changing this setting does not affect existing passwords, but any new password must match this regular expression. Note: Update strong_password_requirements so your users understand the new password requirements.

strong_password_requirements.description: An explanation of the strong password requirements defined by strong_password_regex.
strong_password_requirements.example: Must be at least seven characters long, with at least one capital letter and one number or symbol.

save_metadata_in_package.description: When this option is set to true and the Save metadata to file option is enabled, the metadata file is included inside packages instead of being deposited in the packages root directories.

hide_relay_information.description: This setting hides relay information on the Package details page.

package_upload_timeout.description: The package upload timer starts when a user sends a new package. Even if queued, if a package does not start within the package upload timeout, Faspex marks the package as "Upload never started" and sends a failure notification to the Upload CC list. Increase this duration (in seconds) to account for transfers that may stay queued longer than the default duration.

live_update_interval_sec.description: The interval sets the frequency in seconds that Faspex updates package or relay lists on Packages app.

color_customization_data.description: The representation of the color palette for the theme configuration.

beta_opt_in.description: This allows admin to opt in for Beta program participation.

app_logo_image_url.description: The URL at which your logo image is stored.

app_logo_image_data.description: Data for the image to be used as header logo. The data must be binary and have a maximum size of 512KB.

require_obfuscation.description: Specifies whether to enforce file masking on packages.

file_processing_enabled.description: Specifies whether file processing is enabled. If enabled, an external third-party application must process files in a package and update the package status before the package is made available. Cannot be enabled when downloads_during_transfers_enabled is true.

file_processing_timeout_minutes.description: Specify how long faspex should wait for a response from the external processor before a specific file times out (in minutes).

pkg_processing_timeout_minutes.description: Specify how long faspex should wait for a response for file updates before the entire package times out (in minutes).

initial_target_upload_rate_kbps.description: The default initial target upload rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

initial_target_download_rate_kbps.description: The default initial target download rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

max_target_upload_rate_kbps.description: The default max target upload rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

max_target_download_rate_kbps.description: The default max target download rate for FASP transfers in Kbps.

http_fallback_enabled.description: Specifies whether HTTP fallback is enabled for transfers.

lock_minrate_policy.description: Specifies whether the minrate policy is locked for FASP transfers.

min_connect_version.description: The minimum release version for Connect.

encrypt_transfers.description: Specifies whether transfers should be encrypted.

lock_connect_sdk_version.description: Specifies whether the Connect SDK version is locked.

downloads_during_transfers_enabled.description: Specifies whether users can perform partial downloads of packages during transfers. Cannot be enabled when file_processing_enabled is true.

prefer_http_connect.description: Specifies whether to prefer Connect over HTTP transfers.

encryption_type.description: The encryption cipher used for transfers.

public_url_allowed.description: Specifies whether public submissions links are enabled.

public_url_allowed_default.description: Specifies whether public submissions links are enabled by default.

connect_install_prompt.description: Specifies which users group is prompted to install Connect if connect is not installed.

connect_url.description: The URL hosting the Connect SDK to allow your users to download Connect from a server of your choice. This URL must be accessible to Faspex and to your users.

strong_password_regex.description: A regular expression that can be used to customize strong password requirements. Changing this setting does not affect existing passwords, but any new password must match this regular expression. Note: Update strong_password_requirements so your users understand the new password requirements.

strong_password_requirements.description: An explanation of the strong password requirements defined by strong_password_regex.
strong_password_requirements.example: Must be at least seven characters long, with at least one capital letter and one number or symbol.

save_metadata_in_package.description: When this option is set to true and the Save metadata to file option is enabled, the metadata file is included inside packages instead of being deposited in the packages root directories.

hide_relay_information.description: This setting hides relay information on the Package details page.

package_upload_timeout.description: The package upload timer starts when a user sends a new package. Even if queued, if a package does not start within the package upload timeout, Faspex marks the package as "Upload never started" and sends a failure notification to the Upload CC list. Increase this duration (in seconds) to account for transfers that may stay queued longer than the default duration.

live_update_interval_sec.description: The interval sets the frequency in seconds that Faspex updates package or relay lists on Packages app.

color_customization_data.description: The representation of the color palette for the theme configuration.

beta_opt_in.description: This allows admin to opt in for Beta program participation.

app_logo_text.description: Customized text that will appear on the header logo.

app_logo_image_type.description: The data type of the provided logo image.

app_logo_image_data.description: Data for the image to be used as header logo. The data must be binary and have a maximum size of 512KB.

total_count.description: The total number of contacts that exist for this user.

name.description: The username of user contact or name of workgroup or distribution list contact.

first_name.description: Contact first name. Only available for the "User" types.

last_name.description: Contact last name. Only available for the "User" types.

require_encryption_at_rest.description: Specifies whether to require encryption-at-rest. Only available for the "shared_inbox" types.

metadata_profile_id.description: ID of the associated metadata profile. Only available for the "shared_inbox" types.

submitters_instructions.description: User-defined description of the workgroup/shared_inbox. Only available for the "shared_inbox" and "workgroup" types.

message.description: The reason why the deletion failed.

date_format.description:
d      -   Day of month ( no leading zero )
        dd     -   Day of month ( two digit )
        o      -   Day of the year ( no leading zeroes )
        oo     -   Day of the year ( three digits )
        D      -   Day name ( short )
        DD     -   Day name ( long )
        m      -   Month of year ( no leading zero )
        mm     -   Month of year ( two digit )
        M      -   Month name ( short )
        MM     -   Month name ( long )
        y      -   Year ( two digit )
        yy     -   Year ( four digit )
        @      -   Unix timestamp ( ms since 01/01/1970 )
        !      -   Windows ticks ( 100ns since 01/01/0001 )
        '...'  -   Literal text
        ''     -   Single quote

Username or external email of contact in distribution list.

type.description: Distribution list type. You can only create a global distribution list if you are an admin.

authentication.description: The type of authentication used to provide access to the remote node.

cipher.description: The algorithm used to encrypt data sent during a transfer. Use this option when transmitting sensitive data.

cookie.description: The data to associate with the transfer. The cookie is reported to both client and server-side applications monitoring FASP transfers. It is often used by applications to identify associated transfers.

direction.description: Specifies whether to perform an upload (send) or a download (receive).

download_name.description: The name of the ZIP file created when downloading more than one file.

fasp_port.description: The UDP port for FASP to use. The default value works in most situations, but you may need to configure this port for firewall requirements.

http_fallback.description: Specifies whether to attempt an HTTP transfer if the FASP transfer fails

http_fallback_port.description: The port the destination server is using to service HTTP transfers. Defaults to port 443 if a `cipher` is enabled, or port 80 otherwise.

lock_min_rate.description: Specifies whether to prevent the user from changing the minimum rate during a transfer.

lock_rate_policy.description: Specifies whether to prevent the user from changing the rate policy during a transfer.

min_rate_kbps.description: The minimum speed of the transfer. FASP only shares bandwidth exceeding this value. This value has no effect if `rate_policy` is set to `fixed`.

multi_session.description: The multi-session threshhold value, which specifies (in bytes) the smallest-size file that can be split. Files greater than or equal to the threshold are split, while those smaller than the threshold are not. If the multi-session threshold is 0, files are not split.

rate_policy.description: The rate policy for the transfer.

rate_policy_allowed.description: The type of rate policy allowed for transfer.

remote_host.description: The fully qualified domain name or IP address of the transfer server.

remote_user.description: The Node API user to use for authentication.

source_root.description: A path to prepend to the source paths specified in paths. If this is not specified, then paths should contain absolute paths.

ssh_port.description: The SSH port for the transfer. FASP initiates transfers through SSH.

tags.description: Tags for package, including metadata, package ID, requester details, and recipients.

target_rate_cap_kbps.description: Limit the transfer rate that the user can adjust the target and minimum rates to.

target_rate_kbps.description: The desired speed of the transfer. If there is competing network traffic, FASP may share this bandwidth, depending on the `rate_policy`.

token.description: Used for token-based authorization, which involves the server-side application generating a token that gives the client rights to transfer a predetermined set of files.

zip_required.description: Flag for HTTP Gateway to collect files into a ZIP, if necessary.

PostDownloadTransferSpec.description: Files to download. Required for HTTP Gateway transfers.

paths.description: The list of files to download. Required for HTTP Gateway transfers.

path.description: The path for file or directory.

basename.description: The basename for file or directory.

size.description: The size of the file or directory.

JwtOauthClient.description: Parameters to create an OAuth 2 client for unauthenticated applications.

creator_id.description: The ID of the user who created the OAuth 2 client.

client_id.description: The unique UUID for the OAuth 2 client.

client_secret.description: The secret for the OAuth 2 client.

enable_http_basic_auth.description: Specifies whether this API client can allow http basic authentication. Note: HTTP Basic authentication is a deprecated mode of authentication. Enable with discretion and care.

name.description: The name of the OAuth 2 client.

redirect_uris.description: A list of allowed URLs used for redirection after successful authorization. Must use the HTTPS protocol or a custom URI scheme.

client_type.description: The client type. Choose the client type based on the client's ability to authenticate securely or confidentially. If the client cannot maintain the confidentiality of their credentials, then use **public**.

allow_implicit_grant.description: Specifies whether implicit grants are allowed for the client.

allow_jwt_grant.description: Specifies whether JWT grants are allowed.

allow_global_key.description: Specifies whether you can sign your JWT payload using the client's private key.

public_key.description: Public key for service registrations. Required when **allow_global_key** is **true**.

allow_refresh_token.description: Specifies whether refresh tokens are allowed.

access_token_expiration_hours.description: The hours until the access token expires.

contact_email.description: The email for the person managing the OAuth 2 client.

description.description: The user-defined information for the OAuth 2 client.
description.example: This OAuth 2 client was created for Access Group 1.

origins.description: A list of authorized domains from which the OAuth2 client can receive requests.

refresh_token_expiration_hours.description: The hours until the refresh token expires.

access_grant_all_users.description: All users can use the OAuth 2 client to access the APIs. **Admin only**

access_grant_to_users.description: The list of users allowed to access APIs using this OAuth 2 client. **Admin only**

sort.description: Sort the results by "path", "type" (directory/file), "size_a"(bytes, ascending), "size_d" (bytes, descending), "mtime_a" (modification date, ascending), or "mtime_d" (modification date, descending).

filters.description: Filter response content by these criteria.

basenames.description: Only include results with basenames that match the specified basenames. (Note: Glob patterns are also supported through **[["glob_pattern_here"]]** syntax. For example, use **[["\*example\*"]]** syntax for partial matches.)

mtime_max.description: Only include results updated before this time. Use the format "2011-01-31T12:59:59Z", with T or space in the middle. Z is optional at the end.

mtime_min.description: Only include results updated after this time. Use the format "2011-01-31T12:59:59Z", with T or space in the middle. Z is optional at the end.

paths.description: Only include results that match the path names.

size_max.description: Only include files that are less than this size in bytes.This setting automatically restricts the results to files (equivalent to setting "types":["file"]).

size_min.description: Only include files that are larger than or equal to this size in bytes. This setting automatically restricts the results to files (equivalent to setting "types":["file"]).

types.description: Only include results that match the specified content types

include_sub_dir.description: Specifies whether subdirectories should be included in the filter search.

size_min.description: Only include files that are larger than or equal to this size in bytes. This setting automatically restricts the results to files (equivalent to setting "types":["file"]).

types.description: Only include results that match the specified content types

include_sub_dir.description: Specifies whether subdirectories should be included in the filter search.

offset.description: The index of the first resource in the results.If only one page, this will be 0. If paged result, this will be the index of the first resource.

limit.description: The maximum number of resources to return.

node_id.description: The ID of the node to which this shared folder belongs.

name.description: The name of the shared folder.

default_inbox.description: Specifies whether this shared folder is the default inbox of the node.

directory.description: The root directory of the shared folder.

kbps_initial_target_download_rate.description: The initial target download rate in Kbps for all FASP downloads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

kbps_initial_target_upload_rate.description: The initial target upload rate in Kbps for all FASP uploads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

kbps_max_target_download_rate.description: The max target download rate in Kbps for all FASP downloads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

kbps_max_target_upload_rate.description: The max target upload rate in Kbps for all FASP uploads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

lock_minrate_policy.description: Specifies whether a shared folder's transfers have a locked policy and rate. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

override_transfer_parameters.description: Specifies whether to override the default transfer settings. If set to true, all the following parameters must also be specified. If set to false, you cannot include any of the following parameters.

relay_incoming_bandwidth.description: The bandwidth for incoming relays. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

relay_outgoing_bandwidth.description: The bandwidth for outgoing relays. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

is_custom_inbox.description: Specifies whether this shared folder is being used as a custom inbox by a shared inbox or workgroup

expiration_policy.description: The expiration policy for the package. Default is "none" for no expiration policy (a package will not be marked for deletion based on recipient downloads), "delete_after_all_download" for deleting a package after ALL users do a full download of the package (download of all files/folders in the package), "delete_after_any_download" for deleting a package after ANY user fully downloads and "delete_after_expiration_date" for deleting a package after the date set in expiration_date parameter.

file_processing_status.description: File processing status for the package.

file_processing_msg.description: File processing message that could be set by external file processor.

download_availability.description: A package can be fully available, partially available, or not available. A package is fully available for download if the package is released and files are on the server, if the current user is the package sender, or package contents have been uploaded and state is released. A package is partially available if package contents are still transferring but the global downloads_during_transfers_enabled setting is enabled. Otherwise, a package is not available for download.

expiration_policy.description: The expiration policy for the package. Default is "none" for no expiration policy (a package will not be marked for deletion based on recipient downloads), "delete_after_all_download" for deleting a package after ALL users do a full download of the package (download of all files/folders in the package), "delete_after_any_download" for deleting a package after ANY user fully downloads and "delete_after_expiration_date" for deleting a package after the date set in expiration_date parameter.

file_processing_msg.description: File processing message that could be set by external file processor.

download_availability.description: A package can be fully available, partially available, or not available. A package is fully available for download if the package is released and files are on the server, if the current user is the package sender, or package contents have been uploaded and state is released. A package is partially available if package contents are still transferring but the global downloads_during_transfers_enabled setting is enabled. Otherwise, a package is not available for download.

notify_on_receipt.description: Specifies whether to send a notification when a user receives the package. If true, needs a value for notified_on_receipt.

prevent_http_download.description: Specifies whether a user can download this package via HTTP Gateway.

skip_metadata_validation.description: Specifies whether to skip metadata validation. Skipping validation allows a user to send a package with invalid metadata.

node_id.description: The ID of the node to which this shared folder belongs.

name.description: The name of the shared folder.

default_inbox.description: Specifies whether this shared folder is the default inbox of the node.

directory.description: The root directory of the shared folder.

enable_cloud_referencing.description: Specifies whether the shared folder is on a node using cloud object storage. Cloud referencing must be enabled on the node for it to be enabled on the shared folder.

enable_linking.description: Specifies whether symbolic links are enabled for the shared folder. Symbolic links must be enabled on the node to enable them for the shared folder.

kbps_initial_target_download_rate.description: The initial target download rate in Kbps for all FASP downloads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

kbps_initial_target_upload_rate.description: The initial target upload rate in Kbps for all FASP uploads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

kbps_max_target_download_rate.description: The max target download rate in Kbps for all FASP downloads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

kbps_max_target_upload_rate.description: The max target upload rate in Kbps for all FASP uploads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

lock_minrate_policy.description: Specifies whether a shared folder's transfers have a locked policy and rate. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

override_transfer_parameters.description: Specifies whether to override the default transfer settings. If set to true, all the following parameters must also be specified. If set to false, you cannot include any of the following parameters.

relay_incoming_bandwidth.description: The bandwidth for incoming relays. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

relay_outgoing_bandwidth.description: The bandwidth for outgoing relays. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

is_custom_inbox.description: Specifies whether this shared folder is being used as a custom inbox by a shared inbox or workgroup

test.description: Specifies whether this shared folder should be verified on node before creating a shared folder

relay_error_desc.description: Relay error description from queued job

node_name.description: Name of the node to which this shared folder belongs.

files_completed.description: Total number of files with status completed for the transfer.

started_time.description: The start time of the relay transfer.

GetPackageRequest.description: Request query to browse files in a package

path.description: The full pathname of the directory to browse.

case_sensitive.description: Specify whether to treat the sort and basename values as case sensitive.

sort.description: Sort the results by "path", "type" (directory/file), "size_a"(bytes, ascending), "size_d" (bytes, descending), "mtime_a" (modification date, ascending), or "mtime_d" (modification date, descending).

filters.description: Filter response content by these criteria.

basenames.description: Only include results with basenames that match the specified basenames. (Note: Glob patterns are also supported through **[["glob_pattern_here"]]** syntax. For example, use **[["\*example\*"]]** syntax for partial matches.)

mtime_max.description: Only include results updated before this time. Use the format "2011-01-31T12:59:59Z", with T or space in the middle. Z is optional at the end.

mtime_min.description: Only include results updated after this time. Use the format "2011-01-31T12:59:59Z", with T or space in the middle. Z is optional at the end.

paths.description: Only include results that match the path names.

size_max.description: Only include files that are less than this size in bytes.This setting automatically restricts the results to files (equivalent to setting "types":["file"]).

size_min.description: Only include files that are larger than or equal to this size in bytes. This setting automatically restricts the results to files (equivalent to setting "types":["file"]).

types.description: Only include results that match the specified content types

kbps_max_target_download_rate.description: The maximum target download rate (in kbps).

account_expires.description: Specifies whether the group can expire.

expiration_date.description: The group expiration date.

group_distinguished_name.description: The group distinguished name. This name must be unique.

can_upload_packages.description: Specifies whether group members can upload packages.

can_download_packages.description: Specifies whether group members can download packages.

can_forward_packages.description: Specifies whether group members can forward packages.

can_create_packages_from_remote.description: Specifies whether the group can create packages from remote.

can_create_normal_packages.description: Specifies whether group members can send normal packages. If false, members can send packages to only shared inboxes they can access.

can_invite_external_senders.description: Specifies whether group members can invite external senders.

can_have_public_url.description: Specifies whether the group can have a public URL.

can_send_to_external_email.description: Specifies whether group members can send packages to external emails.

can_send_to_all_faspex_users.description: Specifies whether group members can send packages to all Faspex users. If false, members can send only to other group members.

hide_user_dir.description: Specifies whether the group members keep their user directories private.

can_see_global_distribution_lists.description: Specifies whether group members can access global distribution lists.

allowed_ip_addresses_for_download.description: Array of IP address strings that are allowed to download for this user.

allowed_ip_addresses_for_login.description: Array of IP address strings that a user can login from.

allowed_ip_addresses_for_upload.description: Array of IP address strings that are allowed to upload for this user.

override_server_delete_after_download.description: Specifies whether to override the global server policy for deleting packages after they've been downloaded.

delete_packages_after_download_condition.description: The required condition to delete packages after download.

allow_user_specified_delete_after_downlo.description: Allow group members to configure package deletion settings on a package-by-package basis.

override_transfer_settings.description: Specifies whether the group can have user-specific transfer settings that take precedence over global server settings.

enable_cloud_referencing.description: Specifies whether the shared folder is on a node using cloud object storage. Cloud referencing must be enabled on the node for it to be enabled on the shared folder.

kbps_initial_target_download_rate.description: The initial target download rate in Kbps for all FASP downloads. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

override_transfer_parameters.description: Specifies whether to override the default transfer settings. If set to true, all the following parameters must also be specified. If set to false, you cannot include any of the following parameters.

relay_incoming_bandwidth.description: The bandwidth for incoming relays. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

relay_outgoing_bandwidth.description: The bandwidth for outgoing relays. This parameter is required if override_transfer_parameters is set to true. This parameter cannot be included if override_transfer_parameters is false.

tls_enabled.description: Specifies whether to use the TLS encryption scheme.

packages_recipient_from.description: The name used in notification message specifying the package sender.

username.description: The SMTP server account username. Required when auth_type is login.

password.description: The SMTP server account password. Required when auth_type is login.

default_time_zone_offset.description: The default timezone offset is used for the datetime fields in the email body. This offset value represents the difference in minutes between UTC (offset “0”) and the local time zone. For example: Pacific Standard Time has an offset of "-480".

template_type.description: The email template to test. This will be blank if no template_type is given.

from.description: The From field of the generated email response, formatted in JSON as: { "from_email": "from_name" }.

to.description: The To field of the generated email response, formatted in JSON as: { "recipient_email": "recipient_name" }.

reply_to.description: The Reply-to field of the generated email response, formatted in JSON as: { "reply_to_email": "reply_to_name" }.

subject.description: The subject of the generated email response.

html_body.description: The HTML body of the generated email response.
html_body.example: If you received this message, your email settings are configured correctly.

message.description: The result of the test. If the test failed, provides details for errors.

job_id.description: The job id for test email job.

id.description: Unique ID of the transfer (same as "id").

client_ip_address.description: The IP address of the local node.

server_ip_address.description: The IP address of the remote node.

status.description: The status of the session. If the transfer uses one session, the session status should match the transfer status.

retry_timeout.description: The retry timeout set on the server.

retry_count.description: The number of retries for the session.

start_time_usec.description: Transfer session start time in microseconds since the server's epoch time.

end_time_usec.description: Transfer session start time in microseconds since the server's epoch time.

elapsed_usec.description: The duration of the transfer session, in microseconds.

bytes_transferred.description: The total number of bytes transferred in the session.

bytes_written.description: The total number of bytes written in the session

bytes_lost.description: The total number of bytes lost in the session

files_completed.description: The number of files that are transferred in the session.

directories_completed.description: The number of directories that are transferred in the session.

target_rate_kbps.description: The target transfer rate for the session.

min_rate_kbps.description: The minimum transfer rate for the session.

calc_rate_kbps.description: The calculated transfer rate for the session.

avg_rate_kbps.description: The average transfer rate for the session.

error_code.description: The error code for any transfer session.

error_desc.description: The error description for any transfer session.

enabled.description: Specifies whether precalculation is enabled.

status.description: The status of the precalculation job.

bytes_expected.description: The number of bytes that will be transferred by the session

directories_expected.description: The number of directories that will be transferred by the session.

files_expected.description: The number of files that will be transferred by the session.

files_excluded.description: The number of files that will be filtered from the source paths.

files_special.description: The number of files that are not ordinary files, such as symbolic links.

files_failed.description: The number of files that could not be pre-calculated.

bytes_transferred.description: The total number of bytes transferred across all sessions.

bytes_written.description: The total number of bytes written across all sessions.

bytes_lost.description: The total number of bytes lost across all sessions.

avg_rate_kbps.description: The average transfer rate across all sessions.

files_completed.description: The number of files that are transferred across all sessions.

directories_completed.description: The number of directories that are transferred across all sessions.

start_time_usec.description: The start time of the transfer sessions, relative to the server's epoch.

end_time_usec.description: The time when all transfer sessions complete, relative to the server's epoch.

elapsed_usec.description: The total microseconds for all transfer sessions to complete.

enabled.description: Specifies whether precalculation is enabled.

status.description: The status of the precalculation job.

bytes_expected.description: The number of bytes that will be transferred by the session

directories_expected.description: The number of directories that will be transferred by the session.

files_expected.description: The number of files that will be transferred by the session.

files_excluded.description: The number of files that will be filtered from the source paths.

files_special.description: The number of files that are not ordinary files, such as symbolic links.

files_failed.description: The number of files that could not be pre-calculated.

error_code.description: The error code for any transfer session.

error_desc.description: The error description for any transfer session.

start_time_usec.description: The time the file began transferring, in microseconds since the server's epoch.

elapsed_usec.description: The transfer time for the file, in microseconds.

end_time_usec.description: The time the file stopped transferring, in microseconds.

status.description: The transfer status for the file.

error_code.description: The error code for the file transfer.

error_desc.description: A description of the file transfer error. If no error, "No error".

size.description: The size of the file, in bytes.

type.description: The type of file, either "file" or "link" (for symbolic links).

checksum_type.description: The type of checksum that is calculated for the file by the sender.

checksum.description: The checksum that is calculated for the file by the sender.

start_byte.description: The first byte of the file that is transferred.

bytes_written.description: The first byte of the file that is transferred.

session_id.description: The ID of the session in which the file was transferred.

iteration_token.description: Iteration token indicates the pages until the files data has been retrieved.

authentication.description: The type of authentication used to provide access to the remote node.

cipher.description: The algorithm used to encrypt data sent during a transfer. Use this option when transmitting sensitive data.

cookie.description: The data to associate with the transfer. The cookie is reported to both client and server-side applications monitoring FASP transfers. It is often used by applications to identify associated transfers.

create_dir.description: Creates the destination directory if it does not already exist. When enabling this option, the destination path is assumed to be a directory path.

destination_root.description: The transfer destination file path. If destinations are specified in paths, this value is prepended to each destination.

direction.description: Specifies whether to perform an upload (send) or a download (receive).

fasp_port.description: The UDP port for FASP to use. The default value works in most situations, but you may need to configure this port for firewall requirements.

http_fallback.description: Specifies whether to attempt an HTTP transfer if the FASP transfer fails

http_fallback_port.description: The port the destination server is using to service HTTP transfers. Defaults to port 443 if a `cipher` is enabled, or port 80 otherwise.

lock_min_rate.description: Specifies whether to prevent the user from changing the minimum rate during a transfer.

lock_rate_policy.description: Specifies whether to prevent the user from changing the rate policy during a transfer.

min_rate_kbps.description: The minimum speed of the transfer. FASP only shares bandwidth exceeding this value. This value has no effect if `rate_policy` is set to `fixed`.

multi_session.description: The multi-session threshhold value, which specifies (in bytes) the smallest-size file that can be split. Files greater than or equal to the threshold are split, while those smaller than the threshold are not. If the multi-session threshold is 0, files are not split.

paths.description: A list of the file and directory paths to transfer.

rate_policy.description: The rate policy for the transfer.

rate_policy_allowed.description: The type of rate policy allowed for transfer.

remote_host.description: The fully qualified domain name or IP address of the transfer server.

remote_user.description: The Node API user to use for authentication.

ssh_port.description: The SSH port for the transfer. FASP initiates transfers through SSH.

tags.description: Tags for package, including metadata, package ID, requester details, and recipients.

target_rate_cap_kbps.description: Limit the transfer rate that the user can adjust the target and minimum rates to.

target_rate_kbps.description: The desired speed of the transfer. If there is competing network traffic, FASP may share this bandwidth, depending on the `rate_policy`.

token.description: Used for token-based authorization, which involves the server-side application generating a token that gives the client rights to transfer a predetermined set of files.

PostUploadTransferSpec.description: Files to transfer. Required for HTTP Gateway transfers.

paths.description: A list of the file and directory paths to transfer.

limit.description: The maximum number of resources to return.

kbps_max_target_download_rate.description: The max target download rate in Kbps for all FASP downloads.

kbps_max_target_upload_rate.description: The max target upload rate in Kbps for all FASP uploads.

lock_minrate_policy.description: Specifies whether the users's transfers have a locked policy and rate.

override_default_password_policy.description: Specifies whether the user can override the default password policy Faspex.

override_server_sender_quota.description: Specifies whether sender_quota_limit_mb overrides the Faspex server setting.

override_server_delete_after_download.description: Specifies whether account settings can override the default server settings for deletion after download.

override_transfer_parameters.description: Specifies whether the account settings can override server transfer parameter settings.

password_expires.description: Specifies whether the user's password expires. Requires **override_default_password_policy** set to true.

password_expiration_interval.description: Days until the account password expires. Requires **override_default_password_policy** set to true.

password_history_limit.description: The number of old passwords to prevent the user from reusing. Requires **override_default_password_policy** set to true.

received_cc_notification_users.description: List of users to be notified via CC when receiving a package.

first_name.description: First name of the contact.

last_name.description: Last name of the contact.

role.description: User role. Users cannot change their own role.

self_destructs.description: Specifies whether the account is also deleted when the account expires.

sender_quota_limit_mb.description:
the user's enforced quota limit (in MB) for sending new packages if quotas \
                                            are enabled. Quotas are not enforced if either the user or the recipient is \
                                            a member of an allowlist.

slug.description: The slug of the user used for public invitation. Appears only when public_url is enabled.

uploads_allowed.description: Specifies whether the user can upload packages.

required.description: Specifies whether the user property is required.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user property is enabled.

saml_field_name.description: The SAML field name when the user property belongs to a SAML configuration.

saml_config_id.description: The SAML configuration ID when the user property belongs to a SAML configuration.

value.description: The user property value. You cannot update the value if the user property is configured by SAML. The value is populated by a SAML IDP.

sender_quota_enabled.description: Specifies whether a sender quota limit is enabled.

sender_quota_available_mb.description: The remaining number of MB left in a user's quota.

sender_quota_allow_listed_as_sender.description: Specifies whether a sender is included in the approved sender domains list. Packages sent from users in the approved sender domains do not count towards a user's sender quota.

last_login_client_addr.description: Specifies the user last login client address.

last_login_server_addr.description: Specifies the user last login server address.

manages_shared_inboxes.description: Specifies whether the user manages any shared inboxes. Admins can manage all shared inboxes.

manages_workgroups.description: Specifies whether the user manages any workgroups. Admins can manage all workgroups.

forwards_allowed.description: Specifies whether the user can forward packages.

obfuscation_optional.description: Specifies whether the user has obfuscation enabled.

encryption_at_rest.description: Server setting for encryption at rest.

connect_enabled.description: Specifies whether Connect has been manually disabled.

gateway_enabled.description: Specifies whether HTTP Gateway has been enabled.

gateway_url.description: Address for HTTP Gateway server. Appears only when `gateway_enabled` is **true**.

public_url.description: URL where anyone can request to submit packages. Appears only when enabled.

allow_send_to_email.description: Specifies whether the user can send packages to external emails.

first_name.description: User first name. Not required and not editable for the "saml_user" type.

last_name.description: User last name. Not required and not editable for the "saml_user" type.

email.description: Email ID of the user. Multiple users may have the same email.

account_activated.description: Specifies whether the account is operational.

account_expires.description: Specifies whether the account will expire.

allowed_ip_addresses_for_download.description: The user can only download packages when accessing Faspex from these IP addresses.

allowed_ip_addresses_for_login.description: The user can only login when accessing Faspex from these IP addresses.

allowed_ip_addresses_for_upload.description: The user can only upload packages when accessing Faspex from these IP addresses.

allow_receipt_cc_edit.description: Specifies whether the user can edit receipt addresses when creating a new package.

allow_user_specified_delete_after_downlo.description: Specifies whether the user can set package-deletion settings on a package-by-package basis.

can_create_from_remote.description: Specifies whether the user can create a package from a remote source.

can_have_public_url.description:
Specifies whether the user can share public submission submission links.\
                                            A user can share public submission links to invite external users to \
                                            send packages to the user.

can_invite.description: Specifies whether the user can invite external users to send packages to the user.

can_see_global_distribution_lists.description: Specifies whether the user can see global distribution lists.

can_send_normal_packages.description: Specifies whether the user can send normal packages.

can_send_to_all_faspex_users.description: Specifies whether a user can send packages to all Faspex users.

can_send_to_external_email.description: Specifies whether the user can send packages to external users.

delete_packages_after_download.description: Specifies whether a package is deleted after the user downloads it.

destruction_date.description: Specifies the date when the account will be deleted.

description.example: the account was created on 12/12/12 at 12:00 by User 1204.

enforce_password_history.description: Specifies whether to prevent the user from reusing previous passwords. Requires **override_default_password_policy** set to true.

expiration_date.description: Date for when the user account expires. Requires **account_expires** set to true.

forwarding_allowed.description: Specifies whether the user can forward packages.

hide_user_dir.description: Specifies whether the user's directory is private.
